sections.name: Social Studies
sections.description: This section asks questions about our society, country, and how we live together.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of public properties like roads, schools, and hospitals built by the government?
choices: To make a profit for the government
To serve the needs of all citizens
For the exclusive use of government officials
To simply copy what other countries are doing
questions.answer: To serve the needs of all citizens

questions.question: We celebrate Republic Day in India on 26th January every year because on this day...
choices: India gained independence from the British
The first passenger train ran in India
The Constitution of India, our rulebook, came into effect
Mahatma Gandhi returned to India from South Africa
questions.answer: The Constitution of India, our rulebook, came into effect

questions.question: If you are in a large, dry area of land with huge mounds of sand and very few plants, you are most likely in a:
When adult citizens vote to elect their leaders and representatives, what is this system of government called?
The Taj Mahal, a world-famous monument, is located in which Indian city?
What is the main reason for having traffic lights at a busy road crossing?
choices: To make the road look pretty
To safely manage the movement of vehicles and people
To count the number of cars passing by
questions.answer: To safely manage the movement of vehicles and people

questions.question: Which of these is a major food crop in India that is typically grown in fields flooded with water?
If you witness a crime, such as a theft, which public service department is responsible for investigating it?
In an Indian village, what is the elected local governing body that addresses issues like water supply and roads called?
Why is agriculture (farming) so important for a country?
choices: It is a popular hobby for many people
It produces the food required to feed the population
It is the primary method for building new roads
It uses up a lot of unwanted empty land
questions.answer: It produces the food required to feed the population

sections.name: Biology
sections.description: This section asks questions about plants, animals, our bodies, and the world of living things.

questions.question: What is the primary reason our bodies need to eat food regularly?
choices: Because it is a daily routine
To get energy for our activities and growth
To make us feel full and sleepy
questions.answer: To get energy for our activities and growth

questions.question: If you plant a seed in good soil and provide it with water and sunlight, what will it eventually become?
Which part of a plant is often brightly coloured to attract insects like bees for pollination?
What is the most important reason to wash your hands with soap before you eat?
choices: To make your hands smell good
To remove harmful germs that can cause illness
To make the food taste better
questions.answer: To remove harmful germs that can cause illness

questions.question: Which of the following is a living thing, as it can breathe, grow, and reproduce?
An owl is a nocturnal bird, which means it is most active and hunts for food during the:
When vegetable peels and leftover food are put in a compost pit, they decompose and turn into:
Why is it especially important to drink plenty of water on a hot day?
choices: To help regulate body temperature and prevent dehydration
Because it gives you more energy than food
To make your skin look shiny
questions.answer: To help regulate body temperature and prevent dehydration

questions.question: A tadpole is a baby frog. What is essential for it to grow and transform into an adult frog?
choices: A warm, dry place to live
A diet consisting only of adult frogs
Suitable food and a proper water-based habitat (like a pond)
questions.answer: Suitable food and a proper water-based habitat (like a pond)

questions.question: Most plant leaves appear green because they contain chlorophyll, a substance that helps them to:
choices: Create food using energy from sunlight
questions.answer: Create food using energy from sunlight

sections.name: Physics
sections.description: This section asks questions about how everyday things move, work, and interact with each other.

questions.question: When you throw a ball up in the air, what force causes it to fall back to the ground?
What form of energy is required to power a television, a fan, and a light bulb in your house?
You can see your reflection in a still lake or a shiny steel plate because their surfaces:
During a thunderstorm, you almost always see lightning before you hear thunder. This happens because:
choices: Thunder is a much quieter sound
Light travels significantly faster than sound
Our eyes react faster than our ears
Lightning always happens in a different place than thunder
questions.answer: Light travels significantly faster than sound

questions.question: If you rub your hands together quickly on a cold day, they become warm. This heat is generated by:
choices: The air pressure between your hands

questions.question: Why is it much easier to move a heavy cabinet by placing it on a trolley with wheels?
choices: The wheels make the cabinet weigh less
The wheels greatly reduce friction with the floor
The wheels make a pleasant sound
The wheels heat up the floor, making it smoother
questions.answer: The wheels greatly reduce friction with the floor

questions.question: How does a simple light switch make a bulb turn on and off?
choices: It sends a radio signal to the bulb
It changes the temperature of the wires
It completes or breaks the electrical circuit
It makes a tiny sound that activates the bulb
questions.answer: It completes or breaks the electrical circuit

questions.question: A heavy iron ship can float on water, while a small iron nail sinks. The ship floats mainly because of its:
choices: Large, hollow shape that displaces a lot of water
questions.answer: Large, hollow shape that displaces a lot of water

questions.question: A rainbow is sometimes seen in the sky after it rains on a sunny day. It is formed when:
choices: Colours from the ground reflect into the sky
Sunlight passes through raindrops and splits into different colours
It is a reflection of a painting in the sky
questions.answer: Sunlight passes through raindrops and splits into different colours

questions.question: If you are pushing a heavy cart and your friend starts pushing from the opposite side with equal force, what will happen to the cart?
choices: It will move faster towards you
It will move faster towards your friend
It will stop moving or remain stationary
It will lift off the ground
questions.answer: It will stop moving or remain stationary

sections.name: Mathematics
sections.description: This section has questions about numbers, shapes, and measurements that we use in daily life.

questions.question: You buy a notebook for ₹18 and pay with a ₹20 note. How much change should the shopkeeper return to you?
If a box contains 6 crayons and they are shared equally among 3 children, how many crayons does each child get?
Your favourite TV show starts at 4:00 PM and lasts for one hour. What time does the show end?
Which geometric shape best describes a round chapati or a carrom coin?
A chocolate bar is divided into 4 equal pieces. If you eat 1 piece, what fraction of the whole bar have you eaten?
To measure the length of your classroom, which of these tools would be the most appropriate and accurate?
One pen costs ₹10. How much money will you need to buy 4 such pens?
A shop offers four deals on juice packets. Which is the best deal if you want to pay the lowest price per packet?
The temperature yesterday was 28°C. Today, it is 32°C. Based on this information, which day was hotter?
Look at the pattern of numbers: 5, 10, 15, 20, __. What number should come next?
What is the sum of 150 and 50?
If you subtract 25 from 80, what is the result?
What is 9 multiplied by 7?
What is 54 divided by 6?
Calculate the following: (5 x 8) + 10

sections.name: English
sections.description: This section tests your understanding of simple English words and sentences.

questions.question: In the sentence, 'The dog barked loudly', which word is an action word (a verb)?
Choose the correct word to fill in the blank: 'I saw ___ elephant at the zoo.'
What is the correct plural form of the word 'mouse'?
Which of the following words is the opposite of 'difficult'?
Arrange the following words to form a meaningful sentence: 'is / my / blue / favourite / colour'
In the sentence, 'The red car is fast', which word is a describing word (an adjective)?
Which punctuation mark is needed at the end of this question: 'What time is it'
Which sentence is written in the past tense, talking about something that has already happened?
choices: I will go to the park.
I am going to the park.

questions.question: Which word has a meaning that is similar to 'small'?
Read the sentence: 'The books are on the shelf.' Where are the books?
